Policy Class

Defined in: src/policy.js:7

The Policy registry for freedom.js. Used to look up modules and provide migration and coallesing of execution.

Constructor

Policy

(
  • manager
  • resource
  • config
)

Defined in src/policy.js:7

Parameters:

  • manager Manager

    The manager of the active runtime.

  • resource Resource

    The resource loader of the active runtime.

  • config Object

    The local config.

Add a runtime to keep track of in this policy.

findDestination

(
  • lineage
  • {String]
  • constraints
)
Object

Defined in src/policy.js:104

Find the runtime destination for a module given its constraints and the module creating it.

Parameters:

  • lineage String

    The identity of the module creating this module.

  • {String] Object

    id The canonical url of the module

  • constraints Object

    Constraints for the module.

Returns:

Object:

The element of this.runtimes where the module should run.

get

(
  • lineage
  • id
)
Promise

Defined in src/policy.js:56

Resolve a module from its canonical URL. Reponds with the promise of a port representing the module,

Parameters:

  • lineage String

    The lineage of the requesting module.

  • id String

    The canonical ID of the module to get.

Returns:

Promise:

A promise for the local port towards the module.

isRunning

(
  • runtime
  • id
  • from
  • fullMatch
)
String | Boolean

Defined in src/policy.js:141

Determine if a known runtime is running an appropriate instance of a module.

Parameters:

  • runtime Object

    The runtime to check.

  • id String

    The module to look for.

  • from String

    The identifier of the requesting module.

  • fullMatch Boolean

    If the module needs to be in the same app.

Returns:

String | Boolean:

The Module id if it is running, or false if not.

    The superceeding object

Returns:

Object:
